name: Bad Rats Show
description: Bad Rats Show is a physics puzzle game where the rats exact their bloody revenge against their main enemies: the Cats. Solve puzzles in 2D and 3D maps using physics, objects and specially trained Rats. All new Rats and Cats, but with the same classic and questionable Bad Rats humor.

To preface, these are the important specs of my PC:    Nvidia GeForce GTX 660 2GB VRAM    Intel i7 3770 quad-core processor    16GB DDR3 1600Mhz RAM     Performance: 8/10

This game is a masterpiece.  Just to start things off the graphics are amazing. Better then any Triple A title I have ever seen. The Design and The Art Style is so unique I can be sure you will never find these graphics again intill Half Life 3 comes out.  The soundtrack is a masterpiece. It's like if Jesus Chirst and Mozart had a collab. But better. The music really screams out the game and how unique it is. Just listen to the OST and you can feel yourself getting closer to Lord Gaben.  The gameplay takes the amazing gameplay from the last game and has a fancy dinner date with it and then the day later. Getting married. The puzzles are 10 times harder then the last game which makes the game have HOURS of gameplay which makes the game even funnier!  For the sake of Jesus Chirst.. The original bad rats has touched me in the soul that many other games can not. When i first learned that Bad Rats : The Show had been released i could not contain my joy but unfourtanately due to financial problems i had to wait due to the hefty price of this amazing game. Then One day my friend gifted this to me and quickly i installed it overjoyed to finally be able to play the most anticipated game of 2016.   When i first launched the game i was dismayed that i could not launch in fullscreen even though i had enabled it. Then during the the tutorial the game crashed. I chalked it up to a bug and i relaunched to continue playing the game i had waited so long to enjoy. Then for the next few minutes i was in paradise , the game was amazing I was setting up traps killing cats like it was my day job then once again it crashed , It had been a few minutes and luckily the progress was autosaved so i relaunched then it happened.  It crashed again , then again , then again and i couldn't even progress past the level i was currently on due to crashing. The tragic irony of me waiting so long for one game that i was able to expirence for 0.3 hours before it was brutually stripped away from me leaving me in the cold dark despair that is my life without Bad Rats : The Show . I sit in my dimly lit room with a bottle of jack daniels in my hand and a .44 in the other ready to take my life because of void that Bad Rats: The Show left in me. A Void that can only be filled with the sweet release of crossing the veil into the after life.  TL;DR Games pretty buggy bruh

My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through.' I agreed. At age 19, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because Bad Rats Show gave me cancer anyway.

This game has one of the best soundtracks I have ever heard and has a vast variety of Voice Actors 10/10

It definately has improvements over the first games, but the problem is a lot of those are things the game didn't need! It doesn't need voice acting, it doesn't need glowy arrows and stuff, it doesn't need stranger rats to use in the puzzles, and it doesn't need an explaination of its premise! But still, like the first game, this is just so bizzare you can't help but be entertained and not even care if you solve the puzzles. To some degree, this has a self-awareness of being so-bad-it's-good. Normally when a franchise goes from accidentally so-bad-it's-good to deliberately so-bad-it's-good, it ends up feeling forced, but this keeps everything that made the first game entertaining and presents it in a new flashy format.
